All Paycheck Protection Program loan payments will be deferred for six months. Most importantly, @SBAgov will forgive the portion of the loan proceeds that are used to cover the first eight weeks of payroll costs, rent, utilities, and mortgage interest.

The new Paycheck Protection Program will help small businesses with their payroll and other business operating expenses. It will provide critical capital to businesses without collateral requirements, personal guarantees, or SBA fees—all with a 100% guarantee from @SBAgov.

Our goal at @SBAgov is to position lenders as the single point-of-contact for small businesses—the application, loan processing, and disbursement of funds will all be administered at the community level.
The CARES Act establishes a new $349 billion Paycheck Protection Program. This unprecedented public-private partnership is going to assist small businesses with accessing capital quickly. #COVID19
